text.style: text-anchor: middle; font-family: Khand; font-size: 32.9175px; fill: rgb(17, 17, 17); stroke: rgb(136, 136, 136); stroke-width: 0.5pt;
font-family: Gochi Hand; font-size: 14.2643px; text-anchor: start; fill: rgb(68, 34, 34); stroke: rgb(102, 68, 68);
text-anchor: start; font-family: Gochi Hand; font-size: 14.2643px; fill: rgb(68, 34, 34); stroke: rgb(102, 68, 68); stroke-width: 0.05pt;
text.tspan: Description --- Gallants are flamboyant souls, always seeking attention and the
chance to be the brightest stars. Gallants seek the company of others, if only to
earn their adoration. Attention drives the Gallant, and the chase is often as
important as fulfilling that pursuit. Nothing excites a Gallant so much as a new
audience to woo and win. Performers, only children and those with low self-esteem
are often Gallant Archetypes.

text.style: text-anchor: start; font-family: Gochi Hand; font-size: 14.2643px; fill: rgb(68, 34, 34); stroke: rgb(102, 68, 68); stroke-width: 0.05pt;
text.tspan: System --- Regain a Willpower point whenever you successfully impress another
person. Ultimately, the Storyteller is the arbiter of when you dazzle someone, even
in the case of other players’ characters.

text.style: font-family: Gochi Hand; font-size: 14.2643px; text-anchor: start; fill: rgb(68, 34, 34); stroke: rgb(102, 68, 68);
text-anchor: start; font-family: Gochi Hand; font-size: 14.2643px; fill: rgb(68, 34, 34); stroke: rgb(102, 68, 68); stroke-width: 0.05pt;
text.tspan: Description --- The Masochist exists to test his limits, to see how much pain he can
tolerate before he collapses. He gains satisfaction in humiliation, suffering, denial
and even physical pain. The Masochist defines who he is by his capacity to feel
discomfort — he rises each night only to greet a new pain. Certain extreme
athletes, urban tribalists and the clinically depressed exemplify the Masochist
Archetype.

text.style: text-anchor: start; font-family: Gochi Hand; font-size: 14.2643px; fill: rgb(68, 34, 34); stroke: rgb(102, 68, 68); stroke-width: 0.05pt;
text-anchor: middle; font-family: Khand; font-size: 32.9175px; fill: rgb(17, 17, 17); stroke: rgb(136, 136, 136); stroke-width: 0.5pt;
text-anchor: middle; font-family: Khand; font-size: 32.9175px; fill: rgb(17, 17, 17); stroke: rgb(136, 136, 136); stroke-width: 0.5pt;
font-family: Gochi Hand; font-size: 14.2643px; text-anchor: start; fill: rgb(68, 34, 34); stroke: rgb(102, 68, 68);
text-anchor: start; font-family: Gochi Hand; font-size: 14.2643px; fill: rgb(68, 34, 34); stroke: rgb(102, 68, 68); stroke-width: 0.05pt;
text.tspan: The character spends a single blood point. The next turn, she gains a number of
additional full actions equal to her Celerity rating. These additional actions must be
physical (e.g., the vampire cannot use a mental Discipline like Dominate multiple times in
one turn). So a vampire with Celerity 4 who spends a blood point may perform a total of
five physical actions in her next turn. The actions occur at the end of the turn (the
vampire’s regular action still takes place per her initiative roll). Normally, a character
without Celerity must apply a dice pool penalty if she wants to take multiple actions in a
single turn. A character using Celerity performs his extra actions (including full movement)
without penalty, gaining a full dice pool for each separate action. Extra actions gained
through Celerity may not in turn be split into multiple actions.

text.style: font-family: Gochi Hand; font-size: 14.2643px; text-anchor: start; fill: rgb(68, 34, 34); stroke: rgb(102, 68, 68);
text-anchor: start; font-family: Gochi Hand; font-size: 14.2643px; fill: rgb(68, 34, 34); stroke: rgb(102, 68, 68); stroke-width: 0.05pt;
text.tspan: The player rolls Intelligence + Subterfuge (difficulty of the subject’s Willpower). Projecting
thoughts into the target’s mind requires one success. The subject recognizes that the
thoughts come from somewhere other than his own consciousness, although he cannot
discern their actual origin. To read minds, one success must be rolled for each item of
information plucked or each layer of thought pierced. Deep secrets or buried memories
are harder to obtain than surface emotions or unspoken comments, requiring five or more
successes to access. Telepathy does not commonly work upon the undead mind. A
character may expend a Willpower point to make the effort, making the roll normally
afterward.

text.style: font-family: Gochi Hand; font-size: 14.2643px; text-anchor: start; fill: rgb(68, 34, 34); stroke: rgb(102, 68, 68);
text-anchor: start; font-family: Gochi Hand; font-size: 14.2643px; fill: rgb(68, 34, 34); stroke: rgb(102, 68, 68); stroke-width: 0.05pt;
text.tspan: The player rolls Perception + Empathy. The difficulty is determined by the age of the
impressions and the mental and spiritual strength of the person or event that left them.
Sensing information from a pistol used for murder hours ago may require a 5, while
learning who owned a set of keys found days ago might be a 9. The greater the
individual’s emotional connection to the object, the stronger the impression he leaves on
it — and the more information the Kindred can glean from it. Also, events involving
strong emotions (a gift-giving, a torture, a long fam ily history) likewise leave stronger
impressions than does short or casual contact. Assume that each success offers one piece
of information.

text.style: font-family: Gochi Hand; font-size: 14.2643px; text-anchor: start; fill: rgb(68, 34, 34); stroke: rgb(102, 68, 68);
text-anchor: start; font-family: Gochi Hand; font-size: 14.2643px; fill: rgb(68, 34, 34); stroke: rgb(102, 68, 68); stroke-width: 0.05pt;
text.tspan: The player rolls Perception + Empathy (difficulty 8); each success indicates how much of
the subject’s aura the character sees and understands (see the table below). A botch
indicates a false or erroneous interpretation. The Storyteller may wish to make this roll,
thus keeping the player in the dark as to just how good (or bad) the character’s
interpretation is.

text.style: font-family: Gochi Hand; font-size: 14.2643px; text-anchor: start; fill: rgb(68, 34, 34); stroke: rgb(102, 68, 68);
text-anchor: start; font-family: Gochi Hand; font-size: 14.2643px; fill: rgb(68, 34, 34); stroke: rgb(102, 68, 68); stroke-width: 0.05pt;
text.tspan: In certain circumstances, use of this power requires a die roll: for a normal Perception roll
(the Storyteller may reduce the difficulty by the character’s Auspex rating), to notice a
subject using Obfuscate (see p. 166), or to perceive a threat

text.style: text-anchor: start; font-family: Gochi Hand; font-size: 18.6533px; fill: rgb(68, 34, 34); stroke: rgb(102, 68, 68); stroke-width: 0.5pt;
text-anchor: middle; font-family: Khand; font-size: 18.6533px; fill: rgb(34, 34, 34); stroke: rgb(17, 17, 17); stroke-width: 0.5pt;
text-anchor: middle; font-family: Khand; font-size: 18.6533px; fill: rgb(34, 34, 34); stroke: rgb(17, 17, 17); stroke-width: 0.5pt;
text-anchor: start; font-family: Philosopher; font-size: 14.2643px; fill: rgb(34, 34, 34); stroke: rgb(17, 17, 17); stroke-width: 0.5pt;
text-anchor: end; font-family: Philosopher; font-size: 14.2643px; fill: rgb(34, 34, 34); stroke: rgb(17, 17, 17); stroke-width: 0.5pt;
text-anchor: end; font-family: Philosopher; font-size: 14.2643px; fill: rgb(34, 34, 34); stroke: rgb(17, 17, 17); stroke-width: 0.5pt;

rect.style: fill: rgb(204, 204, 204); stroke: rgb(170, 34, 34); stroke-width: 1pt; cursor: pointer;

text.style: font-family: Khand; text-anchor: middle; font-size: 18.6533px; fill: rgb(0, 0, 0); cursor: pointer; stroke: rgb(51, 51, 51); stroke-width: 0.5pt;

rect.style: fill: rgb(204, 204, 204); stroke: rgb(17, 17, 17); stroke-width: 1pt; cursor: pointer;

text.style: font-family: Khand; text-anchor: middle; font-size: 18.6533px; fill: rgb(0, 0, 0); cursor: pointer; stroke: rgb(51, 51, 51); stroke-width: 0.5pt;

rect.style: fill: rgb(204, 204, 204); stroke: rgb(17, 17, 17); stroke-width: 1pt; cursor: pointer;

text.style: font-family: Khand; text-anchor: middle; font-size: 18.6533px; fill: rgb(0, 0, 0); cursor: pointer; stroke: rgb(51, 51, 51); stroke-width: 0.5pt;

rect.style: fill: rgb(204, 204, 204); stroke: rgb(17, 17, 17); stroke-width: 1pt; cursor: pointer;

text.style: font-family: Khand; text-anchor: middle; font-size: 18.6533px; fill: rgb(0, 0, 0); cursor: pointer; stroke: rgb(51, 51, 51); stroke-width: 0.5pt;

rect.style: fill: rgb(204, 204, 204); stroke: rgb(17, 17, 17); stroke-width: 1pt; cursor: pointer;

text.style: font-family: Khand; text-anchor: middle; font-size: 18.6533px; fill: rgb(0, 0, 0); cursor: pointer; stroke: rgb(51, 51, 51); stroke-width: 0.5pt;
